title: Theresa May's personality could jeopardise a good Brexit deal, says Labour's Sir Keir Starmer
text:
Theresa May's personality could jeopardise a good Brexit deal, says Labour's Sir Keir Starmer The Labour frontbencher launched a blistering attack on the Prime Minister's character Share Shadow Brexit Secretary Sir Keir Starmer addressed the Chatham House foreign affairs think tank (Photo: Getty) Share Get politics updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Theresa May's "guarded, closed" personality risks delivering a poor Brexit deal, Labour warned today. 
Shadow Brexit Secretary Sir Keir Starmer issued a damning verdict on the Prime Minister's character, accusing her of being "unable to build a consensus or form alliances". 
Instead, she used “bland” slogans as "shields to shut out debate", which is “really unhealthy for the future of our country,” he rapped. 
Mrs May will trigger Article 50 , the formal start of the divorce process, on Wednesday, beginning two years of EU divorce negotiations. 
But Sir Keir feared the Tory leader's "isolationist approach … will not deliver the best Brexit deal we can get". Sir Keir issued a damning assessment of the Prime Minister's character (Photo: South Wales Echo) 
Pointing to Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon's threat to call a second independence referendum, Sir Keir told the Chatham House foreign affairs think tank : “The Prime Minister's failure to engage with the Scottish Government, or to recognise the specific and particular concerns, has provided an excuse for the SNP to press ahead with its divisive all for a second referendum on the break up Britain. 
“This is, I fear, becoming the defining characteristic of the way the Prime Minister is conducting the process – guarded, closed, unable to build a consensus or form alliances. 
"Instead of being open and willing to listen on differing views and incredibly complex issues, she's retreated into government by mantra - ' Brexit means Brexit', 'No running commentary', ' No deal is better than a bad deal '; bland phrases designed to shut out dialogue.” 
He said “different leaders lead in different ways”, adding: “Some are open and collegiate and looking for partnerships; so far our Prime Minister has been closed, unwilling to share her plans.” The Shadow Brexit Secretary also claimed another bitter Tory battle is looming (Photo: Getty) 
Sir Keir believed an internal power struggle in the Tory Party is poised to burst into the open when negotiations with the EU intensify, he belived. 
“There is a worrying and increasingly powerful move on the Government's benches to sever our links with Europe. This is the authentic voice of the Brexiteers - those that have argued for decades that exiting the EU offers a once in a generation chance for Britain to extradite itself from the entire European social and economic model.,” he said. 
“Oncer a small minority in the Conservative Party, the Brexiteers are now in office and in power. 
“This ideologically -driven approach to Brexit would be disastrous and divisive.” 
He added: “The Prime Ministers need to face down these Brexiteers who would distance us from Europe.” Sir Keir plans to hold the Government's feet to the fire over Brexit (Photo: Getty) 
The hard right's claim that the UK would crash out of the EU without a trade deal was “gaining currency”, he believed, with a Tory civil war inevitable as the divorce talks unfold. 
“There are undoubtedly two camps in the Conservative Party and on the Conservative benches, and there have been for years,” he said. 
“Differences will out over the course of the next two years.” Like us on Facebook
